intro: Primula boni-auxilii subsp. boni-auxilii, commonly known as the Boniauxilii primrose, is a species native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring rosettes of oval, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in spring. It prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
